title: I Need a Thick, Structured, Uniform Script
content:
Like the subject line says, I need a thick, structured, uniform script. I’m aiming for quick letter recognition in a logo. Any ideas?

 [‹ need a monogram font with letters that form a diamond](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907030245/http:/www.typophile.com/node/33436 "Go to previous forum topic") [Communication arts ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907030245/http:/www.typophile.com/node/4128 "Go to next forum topic")
author: pdxuser

comments.content:
FF Tartine?

What kind of emotion do you want to convey—formal, playful, casual, exotic? There are a lot of scripts out there. More info will help us make better suggestions.
Needless to say, I second that recommendation. Here is [Tartine in use](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907030245/http:/www.fontshop.com/features/newsletters/nov2006_a/).

For a logo, OpenType scripts with alts and ligs would be good, but you won’t find an online typetester that shows them, although Underware does show Bello’s tricks on their site.  
I would recommend my own Handsome Pro Extra Bold, I guess I should produce a PDF which shows all the ligatures and alternates.

I want to convey craving. I like Fabulous by House Industries, but I’m hoping to find something even cleaner. House’s fonts tend to have a bit of whimsy, but I want something a little more, I don’t know, authoritative? Does this sound like any font you know?

[http://houseind.com?page=showfont&id=27&subpage=viewfonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907030245/http:/houseind.com/?page=showfont&id=27&subpage=viewfonts "http://houseind.com?page=showfont&id=27&subpage=viewfonts")

There are some pretty good scripts on this site:

[http://www.hubertjocham.de/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907030245/http:/www.hubertjocham.de/ "http://www.hubertjocham.de/")

But today there seems to be a problem — I can’t navigate there. But it’s worth a try.

The only scripts I can think of that connote “authoritative” are [copperplate scripts](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907030245/http:/www.fontshop.com/fontfeed/archives/bold-formal-scripts/). But these might be too formal for you.

Let me try it this way:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907030245im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/brush_6174.gif)

Brush Script is the general idea.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907030245im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/fab_4420.gif)

Fabulous is closer. Cleaner.

What’s next in this series? I guess I’m looking for something that looks more machine-made. Let the rest of my logo supply the personality, just give me a good trade script.

That helps. It sounds like you’re looking for a brush script. I don’t know that there’s anything that will fit snugly as the “next in the series”, but here are some legible, uniform brush scripts:

[Amorinda](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907030245/http:/www.veer.com/partner/link.aspx?i=1048&c=4&p=products/typedetail.aspx?image=UMT0000021)  
 [Habano](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907030245/http:/www.veer.com/partner/link.aspx?i=1048&c=4&p=products/typedetail.aspx?image=UMT0000014)  
 [Brody](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907030245/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/elsner_flake/brody/)  
 [Mousse Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907030245/http:/www.veer.com/partner/link.aspx?i=1048&c=4&p=products/typedetail.aspx?image=UMT0000162)  
 [Mr Stalwart](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907030245/http:/www.veer.com/partner/link.aspx?i=1048&c=4&p=products/typedetail.aspx?image=UMT0000094)

and a few not so brushy:

[Radio](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907030245/http:/vllg.com/Thirstype/Radio/mudTyper+Weights/)  
 [Galaxie Cassiopeia](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907030245/http:/vllg.com/Village/GalaxieCassiopeia/mudTyper+Weights/)  
 [Freestyle Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907030245/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/itc/freestyle_script_bold/)  
 [Freehand 521](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907030245/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/bitstream/freehand_521_ot/)  
 [FF Market](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907030245/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontfont/ff_market_bd_exp/)
How about the just released [Kinescope](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907030245/http:/www.fontbros.com/cgi-bin/commerce.cgi?key=MASS-KINE&preadd=action) by Mark Simonson. $29 of OpenType goodness.
